channel.title: machine learning on My Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in machine learning on My Portfolio

item.title: Using NLP in Disaster Response
item.description: In this blog, we’ll apply the ETL, NLP, and ML pipeline to analyze disaster data from Figure Eight to build a model for an API that classifies disaster messages. This is one of the most critical problems in data science and machine learning. During a disaster, we get millions and millions of messages either directly or via social media. We’ll probably see 1 in 1000 relevant messages. A few critical words like water, blocked roads, and medical supplies are used during a disaster response.

item.title: End-to-End Machine Learning Project with Deployment Part 1: Project Set-Up
item.description: Many of us often make the mistake of jumping straight into coding when working on end-to-end projects. This approach can work well when dealing with small datasets that don’t need much preprocessing. In these cases, we can quickly train a predictive machine learning model and deploy it in the cloud. But this approach has its limitations. If the project is not set up correctly, the code may not be “reusable” or “scalable”, which can cause problems down the road.

item.title: Disaster Response Pipeline
item.description: PROJECT REPORT: DISASTER RESPONSE PROJECT Web Interface CONCEPT The goal of the Disaster-Response-Pipeline project was to develop a machine learning pipeline that could accurately categorize emergency messages received during a disaster event. The objective was to create an automated system that could quickly identify and classify relevant messages, enabling emergency responders to prioritize and respond effectively to different types of emergencies. DATA The dataset used for this project was obtained from Figure Eight, now Appen, and consisted of labeled text messages related to various disaster scenarios.

item.title: Rental Bike Share
item.description: PROJECT REPORT: RENTAL BIKE SHARE This is an ongoing project. Please visit the GitHub repository: GitHub link to get the latest progress. CONCEPT The Rental Bike Share project aims to develop a system for managing and optimizing the rental of bikes in a city. The goal is to provide a user-friendly platform that allows users to easily rent bikes and helps the bike rental company in efficiently managing their inventory and operations.

item.title: Customer Spending Pojections at Starbucks
item.description: PROJECT REPORT: CUSTOMER SPENDING PROJECTIONS AT STARBUCKS CONCEPT The Customer Spending Projections at Starbucks project aimed to analyze Starbucks’ sales data to understand customer spending patterns and provide insights for offering personalized coupons and recommendations. The project leveraged a dataset consisting of customer profiles, promotional offers, and transaction logs to gain insights into purchase decisions and offer influence. DATASET OVERVIEW The dataset comprised three files: profile.json, portfolio.json, and transcript.json. The profile file contained information about rewards program users, including gender, age, income, and membership details.

item.title: Starbucks Sales Analysis - Part 2
item.description: In Part 2 I will try to address two remaining questions: How to recommend coupons/offers to current customers based on their spending pattern? How to recommend coupons/offers to new customers? I will show you how to build a recommendation system to recommend ideal users for each offer. In other words, my goal is to recommend the best offers to the existing users. In this system, we select an existing offer and recommend top n users for that offer.

item.title: Machine Learning
item.description: Machine Learning: Utilizing frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, and SciKit-Learn, I develop and deploy machine learning models that drive predictive analytics and facilitate data-driven decision-making. Linear Regression K-means Clustering PCA (Principal Component Analysis) Decision Tree Random Forest SVM (Support Vector Machines) KNN (K-Nearest Neighbors) Adaboost XGBoost Necessary ML Tools: Pandas: A data manipulation library that provides easy-to-use data structures and data analysis tools. NumPy: A powerful library for numerical computing in Python, providing support for large, multi-dimensional arrays and mathematical functions.
